title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 February 2014 - XWiki
content:

08:49 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
09:01 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, is there a way how to modify #livetable macro? i need to print custom javascript if livetable macro is used  
09:01 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: even though it's best to avoid modifying default files, you can find this macro defined in macros.vm on your filesystem  
09:02 <vmassol> (you'll just need to perform a merge when you update next time...)  
09:03 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: yep, thanks...  
09:06 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
09:08 <tmortagne> vmassol: Deprecation Fixing Day today, right ?  
09:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: oh right  
09:09 <vmassol> forgot to announce  
09:09 <vmassol> will send email in the coming 15mn  
09:10 <vmassol> hmm http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/page2images-visual-link  
09:10 <vmassol> needs to be converted into xobjects  
09:11 <abusenius> has quit  
09:11 <tmortagne> vmassol: does not seems to have anything to do with XWiki  
09:12 <tmortagne> looks like spam to me  
09:12 <vmassol> indeed  
09:12 <vmassol> interesting spam  
09:12 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <vmassol> they're becoming sophisticated :)  
09:13 <tmortagne> yea, this one is not an automated one for sure  
09:14 <vmassol> mflorea: Hi. I'm fixing XWIKI-10080 . Is this breakage mentioned in the RN somewhere?  
09:16 <mflorea> vmassol: that was not an API  
09:16 <vmassol> you say so but any param is an api  
09:16 <vmassol> a defacto api  
09:16 <vmassol> the proof is here  
09:16 <vmassol> it broke the FAQ app  
09:16 <mflorea> no  
09:16 <vmassol> it's not broken?  
09:17 <vmassol> you broke people that's all  
09:17 <mflorea> show me where it is documented  
09:17 <mflorea> no where  
09:17 <vmassol> oh so the strategy is to not document stuff so that we can break them?  
09:17 <vmassol> :)  
09:17 <mflorea> as with java, there are public and internal stuff  
09:17 <vmassol> I don't agree  
09:17 <mflorea> they were internal parameters  
09:17 <vmassol> it's documented in the SOLR search page  
09:18 <mflorea> link  
09:18 <mflorea> pleasse  
09:18 <vmassol> Solr.SolrSheet or somerthing like that  
09:18 <vmassol> it says:  
09:18 <vmassol> $request.space  
09:18 <vmassol> and $request.wiki  
09:18 <mflorea> that is just code  
09:18 <vmassol> and?  
09:18 <mflorea> it's not an API  
09:18 <vmassol> you think people don't look at the page content?  
09:18 <mflorea> it's internal code  
09:18 <vmassol> it 's never written in that page  
09:18 <vmassol> to not use them  
09:19 <mflorea> it's never written "this is the API"  
09:19 <vmassol> ok now next question  
09:19 <vmassol> is f\_wiki and f\_space documented?  
09:19 <mflorea> you use them at your own risk  
09:19 <mflorea> no  
09:19 <mflorea> none of the parameters are an API at this point  
09:19 <vmassol> then it's bad  
09:19 <vmassol> because nobody can reuse the search  
09:19 <mflorea> the Search UI is in still in development  
09:19 <vmassol> :(  
09:20 <vmassol> you shoufl consider them as unstable apis  
09:20 <mflorea> it wasn't made to be used like this  
09:20 <vmassol> you can break them but they need to be mentioned in the R?  
09:20 <vmassol> RN  
09:20 <vmassol> so that users can update their code  
09:20 <vmassol> in any case  
09:20 <mflorea> first they need to be mentioned as API and they weren't  
09:21 <vmassol> the FAQ app is supported by the core dev team and it got broken  
09:21 <vmassol> even though we'r supposed to know about those param  
09:21 <vmassol> that's not nice  
09:21 <vmassol> ok it could have had some func tests :)  
09:21 <vmassol> on this part  
09:21 <mflorea> it was broken because you're not using an API  
09:21 <vmassol> ok so please modify the FAQ app  
09:21 <vmassol> to use an api  
09:22 <vmassol> it's all yours  
09:23 <vmassol> I'm pushing a quick fix but I'm expecting you to fix it properly because I don't know how to do it, thanks!  
09:26 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: does modification  
09:26 <DarkKnightCZ> \*of macros.vm needs xwiki restart?  
09:26 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: yes  
09:27 <tmortagne>  DarkKnightCZ: macros.vm is the only one that require restart AFAIK  
09:27 <vmassol> mflorea: done on my side with my "hack"  
09:27 <DarkKnightCZ> ok  
09:27 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: it's cached by the velocity engine  
09:27 <vmassol> (becuase it's a velocimacro)  
09:28 <tmortagne> we should probably indicate it at the beginning of the file in a comment  
09:28 <vmassol> now  
09:28 <DarkKnightCZ> yep  
09:28 <vmassol> it's possible to override it in a skin  
09:28 <vmassol> and in this case it's reloaded for that skin (but probably only once, would need to check)  
09:28 <vmassol> since we create a velocity engine per skin  
09:28 <vmassol> ;)  
09:29 <vmassol> (per skin having a macros.vm)  
09:29 <vmassol> the code is in DefaultVelocityManager in case someone is interested  
09:31 <sburjan> vmassol: good morning. could you create the Activiti JIRA project ? Please don't put me the owner, since I don't want reported tasks to be assigned to me  
09:35 <tmortagne> sburjan: it's not because you are the owner that all the task are going to be assigned to you  
09:35 <tmortagne> vmassol does not end up with all the platform jira issue assigned to him  
09:42 <sburjan> tmortagne: you, you're right  
09:48 <vmassol> mail sent  
09:49 <vmassol> mflorea: I know you're very busy with 5.4.x so it might make sense to skip this DFD if you wish. your call.  
09:50 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <mflorea> vmassol: I'll see what I can do  
09:51 <mflorea> ci is dead..  
09:51 <vmassol> restarting it  
09:51 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <tmortagne> vmassol: people should probably announce as answer to your mail what module they are going to work on when they start looking at one  
09:52 <vmassol> indeed, maybe you could reply with this  
09:52 <tmortagne> yep I was about to  
09:53 <vmassol> as usualy hudson doesn't stop, need to kill it  
09:53 <vmassol> btw I've progressed on TC  
09:54 <vmassol> but I need to fix a JDK issue on the agent for TC  
09:54 <vmassol> fyi it's up at teamcity.xwiki.org but it's missing about everything ATM  
10:07 <vmassol> sburjan: done, see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XACTIVITII  
10:07 <vmassol> sburjan: you could create a first jira and close it with a fixversion of 1.0  
10:09 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <tmortagne> mflorea: don't know if you saw it but tika 1.5 is out, since you are assigned to XWIKI-9528 I guess it's better to let you do the upgrade  
10:17 <mflorea> tmortagne: I was just about to commit :)  
10:17 <tmortagne> ok  
10:18 <vmassol> andreeapopescu: just created a jira project for the Diagram App FYI  
10:18 <andreeapopescu> vmassol: thank you  
10:18 <vmassol> s/andreeapopescu/andreeapopescu+mflorea/  
10:19 <mflorea> vmassol: thanks  
10:21 <msmeria> vmassol: hi  
10:22 <msmeria> what fix version should I select for XPOLLAPP-2 ?  
10:23 <msmeria> and another question: why is the id of the project XPOLLAPP ? shouldn't it be POLLSAPP considering there is an XPoll app here: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XPoll+Application ?  
10:23 <msmeria> might cause confusion  
10:25 <vmassol> msmeria: for xpollapp, I'd say 1.0  
10:26 <tmortagne> mflorea: you can probably also close XWIKI-9308  
10:26 <tmortagne> should be fixed by the upgrade too  
10:26 <mflorea> yes, but let me double double check first  
10:31 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <vmassol> btw ci is up  
10:35 <vmassol> taking EmbeddableComponentManager  
10:35 <vmassol> (for DFD)  
10:41 <tmortagne> vmassol: you should tell it in the mail  
10:46 <vmassol> my first jdk7-related commit :)  
10:48 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: sorry I didn't answer you yesterday evening. Unfortunately I still have work for 5.4.2 so I think best is to postpone 5.4.2 for next Monday, knowing that you are not available tomorrow. I'll try to look at the build tomorrow afternoon to make sure you have a stable build as much as possible Monday morning.  
10:48 <mflorea> brb  
10:50 <jflocs> has joined #xwiki  
10:51 <jflocs> Can anyone point me in the right direction for adding a menu bar to my xwiki?  i.e.  the bar that has "Home" "About Xwiki" "Projects"  
10:53 <tmortagne> jflocs: sounds like http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Menu+Application  
10:58 <jflocs> Thanks, I just loaded http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Navigation+Menu+Wiki+Macro#HPrerequisites26InstallationInstructions  
10:58 <jflocs> I will check that out as well.  
10:58 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: Ok and thanks  
11:00 <jflocs> The one you suggested seems a little bit nicer than the one I found.  Thanks for your help  
11:01 <DarkKnightCZ> what are allowed characters for page url? a-z,A-Z,0-9, . , + ?  
11:02 <DarkKnightCZ> or only alphanumeric chars and plus sign  
11:08 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: anything is allowed from XWiki point of view, tomcat does not allow / by default  
11:09 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: ok, so correct regexp is /(/xwiki/wiki/test/get/[.]+/[.]+)/g ? (for example)  
11:10 <tmortagne> ha you actually want to parse a URL, then it's not a XWiki question but a URL question  
11:11 <tmortagne> you can probably use parser but vmassol could give more information than me about that  
11:12 <DarkKnightCZ> yep... there is some "slugification" i guess (and i guess i could use the dot, since i remove forward slashes before that)  
11:21 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <lucaa> has quit  
11:36 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:39 <DarkKnightCZ> gdelhumeau: hi, i've created a little patch for yours livetable excel export macro... since some livetables can have different results page (even when they are created by appwithinminutes, i wonder why), excel export doesn't work for them... this should do the trick -> http://diffchecker.com/dvuyaoiu (the regexp at lines 29,30 could use some tuning, but it works now)  
11:47 <gdelhumeau> DarkKnightCZ: ok, thanks  
12:02 <jflocs> has quit

12:11 <sburjan> I have fixed the title, but I don't think I can change the ID

13:10 <vmassol> sburjan: done  
13:35 <DarkKnightCZ> when programmatically creating attachment, what is the best approach? check if that attachment exists, then replace content, else document.addAttachment?  
13:35 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <sburjan> vmassol: thanks  
13:43 <mflorea> has quit

15:16 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
15:17 <tmortagne1> DarkKnightCZ: re "check if that attachment exists, then replace content, else document.addAttachment?", sounds like the right approach yes  
15:18 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne1: ok  
15:18 <DarkKnightCZ> what has higher priority, velocity code execution or permissions checking? i need to allow access to attachment, but with some kind of authentication (url token, basic authentication), since filename can be determined (filename is the same across subwikis)  
15:19 <tmortagne1> not sure I understand the question, you have right check to know if you have view right on the page containing the velocity and then you also have right check in all public APIS used by the velocity code  
15:19 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:20 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:20 <ekarlso> has quit  
15:23 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne1: well, the file is calendar data (ics), since several calendar clients allows remote file source (http, for auto-synchronizing), i need to allow access to this file for unauthorized users (since you cannot simulate web login only with url), so i figured out two options -> 1) basic authentication (http://user:pass@wiki/attachment), or some url token (?token=qwerty), but i'm not sure if setting that as velocity script executes on attachment requ  
15:25 <polx> has quit  
15:27 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, so there is basic auth fallback :)  
15:29 <tmortagne1> yes basic auth exist in XWiki  
15:29 <tmortagne1> if guest does not have access you should get a basi auth challenge  
15:30 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, basicauth=1  
15:30 <tmortagne1> you can also directly login with preventive basic auth without that basicauth=1 parameter, that's whats EM do to access extensions.xwiki.org  
15:31 <tmortagne1> \*preemptive  
15:32 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, thanks

18:49 <vmassol> [ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project xwiki-enterprise-web: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.xwiki.enterprise:xwiki-enterprise-web:war:6.0-SNAPSHOT: The following artifacts could not be resolved: org.restlet.jse:org.restlet.ext.jackson:jar:2.0.14, org.restlet.jse:org.restlet.ext.jaxb:jar:2.0.14: Could not find artifact org.restlet.jse:org.restlet.ext.jackson:jar:2.0.14 in central (http://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2)  
18:49 <vmassol> anyone has the problem?  
18:51 <vmassol> doesn't seem to be on maven central  
18:51 <vmassol> http://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7Cg%3A%22org.restlet.jse%22%20AND%20a%3A%22org.restlet.ext.jaxb%22  
18:52 <vmassol> checking the restlet repo  
18:53 <GuillaumeF1> has quit  
18:53 <vmassol> ok it's here  
18:53 <vmassol> http://maven.restlet.org/org/restlet/jse/org.restlet.ext.jackson/  
18:53 <vmassol> checking our nexus now  
18:55 <vmassol> hmm it's defined there  
18:55 <vmassol> hmm it's there: http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/restlet/jse/org.restlet.ext.jackson/2.0.14/  
18:56 <vmassol> seems it was a temporary failure....  
18:59 <sburjan> vmassol: usuallyt he artifacts are kept forever on maven central, right ? even older versions

19:23 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: be careful about platform component  
19:23 <vmassol> if it's the one I remember there are some deprecations that are voluntary, need to check more though  
19:27 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
19:35 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I think this is safe, but you can revert my last commit if you disagree  
19:36 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I think I mixed up with the commons one  
19:36 <vmassol> now  
19:36 <vmassol> you have just added new deprecation  
19:36 <vmassol> :)  
19:37 <gdelhumeau> yes ^^  
19:37 <vmassol> are they used?  
19:37 <gdelhumeau> I'm looking just now  
19:37 <vmassol> they should be moved to legacy modules normally  
19:37 <vmassol> the goals is to remove the deprecation calls  
19:37 <vmassol> and then once a method is no longer used to move it to legacy  
19:37 <vmassol> (method or field)  
19:37 <vmassol> (or class)  
19:37 <gdelhumeau> well, as I see, the usages were already deprecated  
19:39 <vmassol>             .appendParent(CLASS\_SPACE\_REFERENCE);  
19:39 <vmassol> why not use the constructor?  
19:39 <vmassol>  new EntityReference("ComponentClass", EntityType.DOCUMENT, CLASS\_SPACE\_REFERENCE)  
19:39 <vmassol> that's what we normally do  
19:39 <vmassol> (gdelhumeau)  
19:39 <gdelhumeau> you are right
